The majority of the quest is set on Ape Atoll, an island inhabited by civilised but unfriendly and high-level monkeys.

Monkey Madness I (#65)
Released 6 December 2004 (Update)
Members Yes
Quest series Gnome
Official difficulty Master
Lead developer(s) Rahul V

Monkey Madness I is a quest in the Gnome quest series and the sequel to The Grand Tree. It involves helping Narnode Shareen once again by tracking down the missing 10th Squad. The majority of the quest is set on Ape Atoll, an island inhabited by civilised but unfriendly and high-level monkeys.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Talk to King Narnode Shareen in the Grand Tree.
Official difficultyMaster
DescriptionThe King of the northern Gnomes, Narnode Shareen, is once again in need of your help. He recently decided to send an envoy of his Royal Guard, the 10th squad, to oversee the decommissioning of the Gnome owned ship-building facilities on the eastern coast of Karamja.

It has been quite some time since the 10th squad were dispatched and they have been deemed missing in action. It will be up to you, should you decide to help, to find out what fate befell the 10th squad and if possible, track them down.

If only it were so simple. Sinister forces have begun to spread through the Gnome hierarchy and threaten to unleash an unknown terror upon the world. Far across the land, the fires of vengeance are being stoked once again. Can you unravel the mystery behind the deception? Can you separate the truth from the lies? Can you decide for yourself what is real and what is not?
Official lengthLong
Requirements
  • Completion of the following quests:
    • The Grand Tree
    • Tree Gnome Village
  • The ability to defeat a level 195 Jungle Demon
Items required
  • A gold bar
  • An empty inventory slot
  • A ball of wool
  • Monkey bones or corpse from Karamja (obtainable during quest)
Recommended
  • 65 Combat level
  • 43+ Prayer highly recommended, as the player will be attacked by numerous hard-hitting melee enemies in multicombat
  • Poison cures such as antipoison potions or antidote++ potions
  • Energy-restoring items such as energy potions and stamina potions
  • Prayer potions
  • A knife for free healing, as there are pineapple plants around Ape Atoll
  • High healing food
  • A Lockpick
  • Weight-reducing clothing
  • Emergency teleport (a ring of life works as well)
  • Ardougne cloak 1 or Ardougne teleports
  • A ring of dueling to bank quickly (the Ardougne cloak could be used instead, somewhat further from a bank; the Battlefield of Khazard has a spirit tree, the gnome stronghold has a bank and the glider service)
  • 200,000 coins (if skipping the puzzle)
Enemies to defeat
  • Jungle Demon (level 195)
Ironman concerns
  • 40 Smithing (boostable) (to make the gold bar if not dropped by a monster) or 33 Magic (boostable) to tele-grab a gold bar from Varrock West bank. A gold bar is also a reward from The Digsite, Goblin Diplomacy, and Waterfall Quest

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

All the routes you'll need to take in the quest.

Warning: Ape Atoll is one of the most dangerous areas in the game, until you obtain a monkey greegree. When going to Ape Atoll, bring plenty of food, antipoison potions, and an emergency teleport, in addition to other required items. Switching off Auto Retaliate and utilising protection prayers will greatly improve your chances of survival.

This quest is divided into 4 chapters.

Chapter 1[edit | edit source]

Items required: 3 free inventory spaces, Gnome Royal Seal (to enter the Karamja Shipyard & convince Lumdo). It is also recommended to bring the items from the next section so that you can save time of having to go back to the bank: lock pick, high-healing food, a form of poison protection, a knife.

"In which our hero/heroine finds himself/herself drawn back into Glough's web of deception and deceit."

Talk to King Narnode Shareen in the Tree Gnome Stronghold. He will tell you to investigate Glough's old shipyard for any trace of the missing 10th squad and will give you the Gnome royal seal. Go to Karamja. You should take the glider at the top of the Grand Tree to Karamja (Gandius). If you do not have monkey bones (or a monkey corpse), kill a monkey to obtain some. Enter the shipyard north of the glider landing site and speak with G.L.O. Caranock, a gnome who is located in the building in the southern area of the shipyard, by the fence. He will act very suspiciously and advise you to return to the king. Return to the king. The Gandius glider is out of service for now, so you'll need to take an alternative route. The quickest way back is to teleport to the Duel Arena using a ring of dueling then run west. Alternatively, you may teleport to the Ardougne Monastery with the Ardougne cloak, then run northwest to the spirit tree. He will give you Narnode's orders and tell you to speak to Daero. There is a bank within the Grand Tree on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US]. Use this time to bring some food, antipoison potions, and any other items to survive Ape Atoll (see recommended items above). Talk to Daero, the new head tree guardian, on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree, near Blurberry Bar to the east. Go through all the chat options and then tell him you're prepared to leave. He will blindfold you and take you to an underground hangar. Talk to Daero again who will introduce you to Waydar. Then, you will have to solve a "reinitialisation" puzzle. Do this by clicking on the panel to the south-east by the southern glider. Players can take some spare controls from the nearby crate to view the solution.

The solution to the reinitialization puzzle.

Solve the sliding puzzle.

  1. Begin by maneuvering the 1, 2 and 3 into their proper positions in the upper left corner.
  2. Position the 4 in the upper right corner.
  3. Maneuver the 5 under the 4
  4. Now slide the 4 to the left and the 5 up; the first row is done.
  5. Repeat this process with next row, leaving row above intact.
  6. The pieces in the last two rows then need to be solved together, working left to right, completing the last rows as 2 tiles high columns.

This is similar to the puzzle boxes from Treasure Trails, so if you have done those before, this sliding puzzle will be easy to complete. If you cannot solve the puzzle or do not want to spend your time with it, bring 200,000 coins and go to Glough. Glough still resides where he did during the Grand Tree quest. If you pay Glough, return back to the hangar via Daero; Glough will leave you one tile to slide to complete it. Talk to Daero, then Waydar. The two of you will make landing on Crash Island, where the 10th Squad crash landed. Ask Lumdo to sail to Ape Atoll. As he has conflicting orders from his sergeant, Garkor, he will refuse to take you. Talk to Waydar (watch out for poisonous scorpions just to his left, and do not click "Travel", as this will bring you back to the Grand tree prematurely). Speak with Lumdo again, and he will now agree to take you to Ape Atoll.

Caranock speaks with the foreman.

Chapter 2[edit | edit source]

"In which our hero/heroine finds themselves engaging in severe quantities of monkey business."
Note: There is no necessary combat until Chapter 4: "The Final Battle."

Part 1[edit | edit source]

Items required: Recommended: High-healing food, a form of poison protection, and a knife for free healing off of pineapple plants.

Note: At any point, you can teleport or flee from Ape Atoll to restock items. (To get back to the bank, you can talk to Lumdo to go from Ape Atoll back to Crash Island. Then talk to Waydar on Crash Island to go back to Tree Gnome Stronghold. Then you can use the bank in the Grand Tree. Then to resume the quest, talk to Daero on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the Grand Tree to go back to the hangar, then talk Waydar in the hangar to go back to Crash Island, then talk to Lumdo on Crash Island to return to Ape Atoll.) All native creatures other than the level 5 Birds of Ape Atoll will be aggressive regardless of your combat level as long as you are in human form. You can hug the southern coast of Ape Atoll, heading west, to avoid the poisonous snakes and spiders. You may encounter only one or two snakes this way, and you can avoid them easily by waiting for them to pass.
The layout of the jail.
Blue: Door
Red: Dentures crate
Green: Banana crate
Yellow: Sleeping guard monkey
Garkor's location.
The location of the M'amulet moulds.

Once on the Atoll, start going west, sticking to the southern coastline, until you reach a mahogany tree, at which point you should run north. Aggressive level 24 snakes, level 38 scorpions, and level 42 jungle spiders, all of which are poisonous, will attack if you are within their vicinity. Activate Protect from Missiles as you travel north, as a volley of poisoned arrows will start pelting you as you reach close to the Ape Atoll gate. You will be knocked out and placed into prison.

You awake in a cell guarded by Trefaji and Aberab, the two prison guards. Speak to Lumo, one of the captured 10th Squad members. Stay one square away from the northern cell wall (near the patrolling guards' path) if the guards are in front of it, or else they will punch you for 10-20 damage. The guard will patrol twice throughout the prison, then leave to rotate shifts. As the guard moves away from your cell door, pick lock the door until you succeed. Once out, as the guard is walking out to switch, walk behind him to reach the exit. Note that this may take several tries.


Travel north of the jail, then east to find Karam, a member of the 10th Squad in the bushes near the crafting shop (chisel icon). Karam is mostly translucent and he can be difficult to spot, so look carefully. Travel south, past the large door, keeping in the jungle grass. When you are in the grass, the monkey archers do not fire, but activate Protect from Missiles as a precaution. Once you are past the door, go around the castle counter-clockwise, east, until you are between the white building just south of the castle and the castle. To the east of that building is Garkor, the Sergeant of the 10th Squad.


Speak with Garkor. Make sure to get all the way through the dialogue to the point where he tells you to go meet Zooknock.

Sprint west through the grass with Protect from Missiles on. Continue west (south of the buildings) in the grass until you reach the doorway to your north, the blue square on the map image with the red, blue, yellow and green square. Walk through the door marked by the blue square that will let you enter an enclosed area with a sleeping monkey guard, a banana crate, and a dentures crate.


Enter the door. When inside this house, stay on the dark brown ground or you may be sent back to jail. The spiders inside are aggressive and poisonous, but their poison only hits '1' so it would be wise to save the antipoisons. There are bananas in the southwestern crates next to the ladder. Staying on the dark brown, step east and north, and search the stacked crates towards the middle of the room to acquire monkey dentures. The sleeping guard is a non-threat so long as you don't talk to him, otherwise he will call for guards. Search the south-eastern most crate and where a prompt appears. You will take damage if you drop down into the cavern below, so heal up if necessary before entering. Your Agility level also has a chance to negate this damage. Travel to the north-west part of this cavern, and search the crates to acquire the M'amulet mould.


If you need to resupply, you can exit the city by going to the south-east corner of the city. Run past the guards and the gravedigger to a ladder. Go up, jump off the bridge, and go back to the boat to Crash Island. You could also teleport out.

Part 2[edit | edit source]

Items required: Monkey dentures, m'amulet mould, gold bar. Recommended: 1-2 antipoison potions, 4+ energy potions (or other energy-restoring items such as the Explorer's ring), 4+ prayer potions (none will be necessary if flicking the Zombie monkeys), some food, a plank (not actually necessary, but can be obtained during the quest anyway), and an emergency teleport (Ardougne cloak is recommended, or use a dueling ring to go to the Duel Arena, near a bank and glider).

Note: It's recommended to teleport out and bank at this point. The Zombie monkeys pose a significant nuisance as they will hit you while you are running past, they hit somewhat accurately and can deal moderate damage (max of 7). The whole dungeon is a multicombat area. The real threats are the gorilla skeletons; they are densely packed and hit accurately and quite hard (up to 12).
Ironmen: If you don't have access to energy potion or prayer potions but have completed Recruitment Drive, you can wear Initiate armour to reduce the Prayer drain while travelling through the cave.
Ape Atoll Dungeon

Bank if necessary. Return to the Grand Tree and return to Daero on the 1st floor to get back to the glider hanger, and then to Ape Atoll afterward. Travel to the south of the island, west of Lumdo, and enter the tunnel (). (A plank can be obtained in a run-down shack further west on the island)

Once within the dungeon, you must travel through a long, winding underground path (see the image of the map). It is suggested to activate Protect from Melee as you make your way toward the north passage, flicking it off when not near any enemies to save prayer. The player will occasionally be hit by rocks, indicated by the screen shaking and a rumbling noise. The rocks can be avoided by sheltering under the numerous overhangs (grey areas on the map above), but can be largely ignored. The claw traps near the end of the dungeon can be easily avoided by stopping one square behind them and then running through; the plank is not actually needed, but can also be placed on the flat rock. Level 1 spiders are ubiquitous within this area, along with level 98 monkey zombies and level 142 skeletons. At the end, you will find Zooknock, Waymottin and Bunkwicket; talk to Zooknock then use your m'amulet mould, gold bar, and monkey dentures on him. Make sure you are given an enchanted bar before leaving the tunnel. You MUST talk to Zooknock again! (If the enchanted bar is not given, use the monkey dentures, m'amulet mould, and gold bar on Zooknock.) Do not use the m'amulet mould on Zooknock when you already have the enchanted bar otherwise he will keep it and you will have to obtain another.

Part 3[edit | edit source]

Items required: Enchanted bar, m'amulet mould, ball of wool, five free inventory slots for the bananas. Recommended: 1-2 antipoison potions, lockpick (optional), a teleport (Ardougne cloak or dueling ring recommended), and food. If you are going to do Recipe for Disaster, kill a Monkey Guard for a Gorilla greegree later. (This requires ranged/magic at lower levels as Monkey Guards heal 25 hp when under 20% health in melee range.)

Teleport, and bank if necessary. Return to Ape Atoll afterward, and continue north-west until you are placed in the jail cell again. Escape the cell as before. Travel east towards the temple door.

The trapdoor is directly next to the ladder.

Now, you must descend down through the trapdoor to the east in the temple (see inset map). Activate Protect from Melee to negate attacks from the powerful monkey guards. Most of the guards can be run through, but the ones with beards near the trapdoor cannot. The easiest route is to go upstairs, then climb the ladder down on the east side to get close to the trapdoor. If you do not, you should wait until the guards walk away. Hide in the north-east corner of the temple until there is enough room which you are able to descend. Be careful not to get surrounded or cornered by the monkey guards, or else you may be unable to escape (if you happen to get surrounded, go up the stairs and hop worlds). The ladder near the trap door can only be climbed up from the EAST side. You can also restore prayer points if needed at the monkey altar.

Go down the trapdoor, still praying against melee. Ignore the monkey zombies (or kill one and pick up the bones in case you want to do Recipe for Disaster (see below)), and swiftly use the enchanted bar on the wall of flames. Travel back up the ladder or find a safespot to get away from the foes. Teleport away from Ape Atoll if you need to replenish supplies. Use the ball of wool with the amulet. After you have created the m'speak amulet, you can either teleport out to resupply or continue on to the next step. Be careful! You will most likely be trapped again when you ascend the ladder, so be sure to activate Protect from Melee if you haven't already done so. Head to the building west of the jail (make sure you either sneak around in the grass, or use Protect from Missiles to run directly there). To the west of that building, there should be a banana garden that has a Monkey Child in it. The Monkey Child is being patrolled by The Monkey's Aunt. She follows a predetermined path that loops around the wooden house by the garden. Do not enter the banana garden when the monkey's aunt is present or she will call for guards to arrest you (if this happens, you can escape by quickly climbing up the ladder in the building beside). Wait for the aunt to walk away, then speak to the monkey child.

Tip: Using the ladder in the monkey's aunt's house nearby can help you escape the guards if the monkey's aunt catches you, but do not speak to The Monkey's Uncle upstairs or else he will call the guards too.

Tell the monkey child that you are his uncle. After he reveals that he is supposed to collect 20 bananas, search and pick five (5) from the nearby trees. You do not actually need 20; five is enough as the monkey cannot count. Wait for a few moments in the corridor, then return to the monkey child when the aunt is away. Ask the child to borrow his Monkey talisman. The drop trick can be used to get more than one; you will need to drop it and then speak to the monkey child, telling him you have lost the talisman. Then wait or hop worlds as the monkey child will start to cry and will not immediately give you another one. Alternatively, talismans can be purchased from Tutab's Magical Market for 1000 coins. The shop method only works if you have previously made at least one greegree, as Tutab will not open his shop unless you are in monkey form. Get one talisman for each greegree you want, four are needed for Recipe for Disaster (see the below section). Exit Ape Atoll.

Note: For the Recipe for Disaster quest, you should get a total of four (4) talismans. Talismans can be purchased for 1000gp each at Tutab's Magical Market. Again, this method ONLY works if you have previously made at least one greegree, as you cannot access Tutab's shop in human form. Read below for info regarding the monkey bones you should gather for the quest.
Warning: Using teleportation of any sorts that take you out of Ape Atoll while wielding a greegree will forcibly unequip it to your inventory by the destination, if your inventory is full the greegree will be lost and you will have to make a new one.

Recipe for Disaster: You will also need the additional three (3) greegrees (4 total (1 for Monkey Madness and 3 for Recipe for Disaster)). Each of these requires one talisman for a total of 4 talismans plus their respective monkey bones: You will save yourself 1-2 trips if you get all of these before going to Zooknock at this point. For all of the bones, you must kill one of each of the following: Monkey (monster) for the current quest, Monkey Archer, Monkey Zombie and Monkey Guard for recipe for disaster. A Monkey Guard can be killed much more easily by safespotting it, they will only heal in melee range. The easiest ones to kill are located upstairs. Go through the front entrance (have Protect from Melee on then turn it off once you get up the ladder) then head for the southern ladder. You will find yourself in a corridor where you can safespot the guard. Once you have all of the required bones and talismans, take all 4 bones and 4 talismans to Zooknock to create them. If he does not take the next bones you give him right after he gives you your greegree, talk to him, and ask him to make another greegree. If this doesn't work, then try the drop trick with your greegree(s).

Part 4[edit | edit source]

Items required: Materials for making the greegrees you want. For Monkey Madness I, only one monkey talisman and Monkey bones or corpse are needed (make sure those are Karamjan monkey's bones or corpse; otherwise, you will have to run back again.). Recommended: 1-2 antipoison potions, energy potions, prayer potion and food, a plank, Ardougne teleport.

Bank for the necessary items and make sure you have a teleport again. If you have previously given Zooknock the bones or corpse, you do not need to re-obtain one. You will be heading back to Zooknock through the tunnel again. Return to Ape Atoll. Travel through the tunnel for a second time, and use the monkey talisman and the monkey bones (the left-click option for all types of bones is bury) (or corpse) on Zooknock. After a brief delay and conversation, you will get a greegree corresponding to the bones you used on him. To make another greegree, you have to first talk to him again and ask him if he can make another. If you cancel the conversation accidentally, ask how to make the monkey talisman and it will resume.

Chapter 3[edit | edit source]

Items required: Karamjan monkey greegree, m'speak amulet, 1 free inventory space. Recommended: Ardougne teleport.

In which our hero/heroine finds himself/herself contending with life as a monkey.

Note: In this chapter, you will be required to speak with Awowogei and retrieve a monkey from the Ardougne Zoo. You can skip to retrieving the monkey in Ardougne (Step 4) if you want to bank or resupply. You can speak with Awowogei when you return to Ape Atoll (Steps 1-3).


Step 1: Wield the monkey greegree (Karamjan only; the others WILL NOT work) to become a monkey! In this form, you will not be approached or attacked by any of the monkeys or wildlife on the island.

Return to Garkor, and speak to him in monkey form. Then, with the m'speak amulet equipped, talk to the Elder Guard near Garkor, and he will tell you to speak with Kruk.


Step 2: Run west, until you pass the main gate into Marim and have reached the Western shore of Ape Atoll (do not exit the gate). Head slightly south and follow a path up the western hill, then climb up the bamboo ladder at the top and cross the bamboo bridge. Take the ladder on the east side down and speak to Kruk and he will conveniently take you back to King Awowogei.


Step 3: Speak to Awowogei and offer an alliance. He will ask you to rescue a monkey from the Ardougne Zoo. IMPORTANT: If you have a full inventory, DO NOT TELEPORT while wielding the greegree, as it will be dropped and potentially lost if you do.


Caranock, Waydar and King Awowogei plotting.

Step 4: Travel to Ardougne and enter the zoo. Wield the greegree to become a monkey. Speak to the Monkey minder (as a monkey), who will place you in the cage. Speak with a monkey (the only one with a "Talk" option), and it'll hop into your inventory. Unequip the greegree and speak to the Monkey minder again. He will be confused and let you out. You will now need to travel by foot to the Gnome Stronghold, and climb up to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] and talk to Daero to travel back to Ape Atoll as usual. IMPORTANT: Any method of teleportation (including random events) will result in the monkey leaving your inventory.

Extra: Your new monkey friend will supply you with some humorous dialogue, and examining him will get you poked. If you have any bananas in your inventory, he will most likely eat them. There is also a 1/256 chance that he will give you a clue scroll (medium) if you use bananas on him directly. Note that you must go through the entire dialogue. Only one clue may be obtained per player[1].


Return to Ape Atoll, and equip your greegree.


Speak with Awowogei again. (If you have spoken before, you can simply speak to the Elder Guard, and he will let you in. If you have not, see Steps 1 through 3, above.) The monkey will automatically leave your backpack and Awowogei will consider an alliance.


Speak with Garkor to begin Chapter 4.

Chapter 4[edit | edit source]

Items required: Greegree. Recommended: 1-2 antipoison potions, food and combat equipment to defeat a level 195 Jungle Demon.

"The Final Battle"

Note: You can teleport to the Jungle Demon fight from anywhere in Gielinor, except for the Wilderness, by simply equipping the 10th squad sigil.
The 10th squad and the player fight the demon.

Speak with Garkor one more time (as a human or monkey). He will give you a 10th squad sigil. Do not equip it until you are ready for the final battle! If you lose your last sigil, you must speak with Garkor again, who will send you to Waymottin at the end of Zooknock's tunnel. Don't lose it.

Bank in preparation for the Jungle Demon fight. Ensure you have full prayer points and health. When you are ready to fight, wear the sigil. You will be teleported to the Jungle Demon's arena shortly thereafter. Defeat the Jungle Demon to advance. The 10th Squad gnomes will be nearby to help you, but you must deal the final blow yourself, or the demon will heal for 25% of his max health.

Note: This is NOT a safe battle. If you die during the battle, you will respawn with your 3 most valuable items. Go to Death's Office to retrieve your sigil and greegees, as well as many other items for free. If you teleport back into battle immediately, you can recover any other lost items.

Potential strategies for fighting the Jungle Demon include the use of a Dwarf multicannon, by ranging/maging, or by luring the demon into the midst of 10th Squad gnomes. Bring prayer potions, good food (lobsters or better), and a one-click teleport just in case. Protect from Magic is crucial, and should ideally be turned on just before you teleport. Bring an antipoison as well for the post-battle sequence.

Other strategies include:

  • Strategy for Ranged/Magic: Attacking with Magic or Ranged as well as having 37+ Prayer is recommended. There is a safespot in the arena across a bridge on the outside edge. From there, you can either range him, or lure him into the 10th Squad gnomes, who can weaken him. Once the Jungle Demon is within lethal range, with Protect from Magic still activated, run up to the Jungle Demon and Melee it once and run back. This will prevent the Jungle Demon from using his Melee attack while he continues to hit you with Magic which you protect from. Standing still once you are teleported to the arena will keep distance between you and the Jungle Demon. The demon will not move, and thus will not be able to approach you and use its Melee attack, which will result in you taking no damage throughout the fight as long as you keep your prayer up.
  • Strategy for Melee: Using rings of recoil will help, especially when he hits hard. When the Jungle Demon reaches 1 HP from the gnomes, there will be a period of a few seconds before it regenerates its health. You can use Melee with this method. Another possible safespot is to block him on the middle area of the arena then walk over to him while he is still stuck (make sure to stay touching the wall while walking over or he will leave the wall and run at you) pray magic and you can get into halberd range without being hit by melee attacks.

Finishing up[edit | edit source]

Once the Jungle Demon is slain, speak to Garkor, who is indicated by an arrow. He will tell you to speak to Zooknock to be teleported out. Speak to Zooknock to be teleported to Ape Atoll. If players decline the offer and stay, they are free to explore the banana plantation. However, Zooknock leaves, meaning that the other gnomes are the player's teleport out. In the base of the statue is a crack, which players can enter and speak to Bonzara. He offers to teleport the player out of the arena at the end of the conversation.

  • Warning: Both teleporters will put you in the jungle on Ape Atoll near poisonous and aggressive monsters, so be sure to have anti-poison! It is advised to simply teleport off of the island as quickly as possible (unless you're a level-1 Defence pure; see below). If you want to stay on the island, you should equip your Greegree immediately after being teleported by the gnomes.

Escape the island however you like, either through the main gates as a monkey, with any form of teleport, or by jumping off the bridge in the south-east part of the city. Go back to Gnome Stronghold.

  • Advice for 1-Defence pures: Before returning to King Narnode, it is recommended that you: 1. Chop and burn a teak log (note, log must be cut from a teak tree on Ape Atoll) and fish for raw bass for the medium Western Provinces Diary. 2. Chop and burn a mahogany log and do a lap of the agility course for the hard Western Provinces Diary. 3. Have a zookeeper put you in Ardougne Zoo's monkey cage for the hard Ardougne Diary.
  • Note for 1-Defence pures: Talking to King Narnode and completing the quest will result in you no longer being able to return to Ape Atoll without claiming the experience, which will raise your Defence to at least 33. Do not finish the quest before training on skeletons with chinchompas if you intend to make use of the training location in the future. As a pure, you can kill the Jungle Demon and still return to Ape Atoll after its death, but if you talk to King Narnode, you will be unable to return without getting the Defence experience.

Speak with King Narnode in the Grand Tree to finish the quest.

Congratulations! Quest complete!

Narnode will then redirect you to Daero for your training as a new 10th squad member, so go have a chat with Daero for the experience rewards.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 3 Quest points
  • 10,000 Coins
  • 3 Diamonds
  • Speaking to Daero after the quest gives the choice of either, 35,000 experience in Attack and Defence and 20,000 experience in Strength and Hitpoints OR 35,000 experience in Strength and Hitpoints and 20,000 experience in Attack and Defence. Returning to Ape Atoll after completing the quest requires undergoing Daero's training.
    • Note for 1-Defence pures: You cannot go back to the bunker (and thus back to Ape Atoll) without speaking to Daero and gaining Defence XP. The only way to return to Ape Atoll as a pure is to stop the quest after killing the Jungle Demon. Do not talk to King Narnode Shareen.
  • The ability to buy and wield the Dragon scimitar.
  • The ability to turn into a monkey in Ape Atoll & Ardougne Zoo, using the Monkey greegree.
  • Full access to Ape Atoll. (Bank is unlocked after Monkey Madness II.)

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of Monkey Madness I is required for the following:

  • Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowogei
  • Monkey Madness II

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
10 May 2016 — 28 July 2016

The quest was renamed from Monkey Madness to Monkey Madness I.

26 November 2015
(update)

Typo correction: to was used rather than too in Monkey Madness.

2 July 2015
(update | poll)

Added a fairy ring midway through the Ape Atoll agility course. Using this fairy ring requires completion of Monkey Madness and Daero's training.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • If you talk to Zeke, the scimitar seller of Al Kharid, and ask him for a Dragon scimitar, he will respond, "The banana-brained nitwits who make them would never sell any to me. Seriously, you'll be a monkey's uncle before you hold a Dragon Scimitar." This dialogue is a reference to this quest, during which you pretend to be a monkey's uncle in order to obtain a monkey talisman.
  • If you have started Fairytale II - Cure a Queen, completing this quest and receiving Daero's training unlocks a new fairy ring location in the Ape Atoll agility course. In order to leave the small area where the fairy ring is located, you will need a ninja greegree and 48 Agility to continue through the remainder of the agility course.
  • If you tell Zooknock you lost the amulet, you will have to get the materials to create a new one.
  • If you wear a M'speak amulet and listen to the enchanted bar, it says "I'm stuck in this horrible gold bar!"
  • The chapter cards and cut scenes in this quest are references to the adventure game series Monkey Island.
  • Upon first talking to Awowogei, Uwogo says to "never trust a northern monkey". This is in reference to the friendly rivalry between the north and the south within the UK (Northern Monkeys, Southern Fairies).
  • You can pick up the Karamjan monkey King Awowogei requests after bringing him to the island. If a player picks up the monkey delivered to King Awowogei after bringing him to the king, travels to Karamja by foot and drops the monkey, the player will receive their level in Thieving experience multiplied by two.
  • Karam seems to be a reference to Kalam Mekhar (a character from Steven Erikson's Malazan book of the fallen) and the 10th squad in general could be a reference to the Bridgeburners 9th squad from the same series.
  • This entire quest was created by one intern at Jagex during a summer internship.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 9 March 2016. (Archived from the original on 30 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "1/256, and it's once only per player."

rawContent:
{{External|rs=Monkey Madness}} {{Redirect3|Monkey Madness|For the sequel, see [[Monkey Madness II]]}} {{Floor}} {{Has quick guide}} {{Infobox Quest |name = Monkey Madness I |number = 65 |image = [[File:Monkey Madness I.png|300px]] |release = [[6 December]] [[2004]] |update = Monkey Madness |members = Yes |series = [[Quests/Series#Gnome|Gnome]] |difficulty = Master |developer = Rahul V }} '''Monkey Madness I''' is a quest in the [[Gnome quest series]] and the sequel to [[The Grand Tree]]. It involves helping [[Narnode Shareen]] once again by tracking down the missing [[10th Squad]]. The majority of the quest is set on [[Ape Atoll]], an island inhabited by civilised but unfriendly and high-level [[monkey]]s. ==Details== {{Quest details |start = Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]]. |difficulty = 4 |description = The King of the northern Gnomes, Narnode Shareen, is once again in need of your help. He recently decided to send an envoy of his Royal Guard, the 10th squad, to oversee the decommissioning of the Gnome owned ship-building facilities on the eastern coast of [[Karamja]]. It has been quite some time since the 10th squad were dispatched and they have been deemed missing in action. It will be up to you, should you decide to help, to find out what fate befell the 10th squad and if possible, track them down. If only it were so simple. Sinister forces have begun to spread through the Gnome hierarchy and threaten to unleash an unknown terror upon the world. Far across the land, the fires of vengeance are being stoked once again. Can you unravel the mystery behind the deception? Can you separate the truth from the lies? Can you decide for yourself what is real and what is not? |length = Long |requirements = * Completion of the following quests: ** [[The Grand Tree]] ** [[Tree Gnome Village]] * The ability to defeat a level 195 [[Jungle Demon]] |items = * A [[gold bar]] * An empty inventory slot * A [[ball of wool]] * [[Monkey bones]] or [[Monkey corpse|corpse]] from [[Karamja]] (obtainable during quest) |recommended = * {{SCP|Combat|65|link=yes}} * {{SCP|Prayer|43+}} [[Prayer]] '''highly recommended''', as the player will be attacked by numerous hard-hitting melee enemies in multicombat * [[Poison]] cures such as [[Antipoison|antipoison potions]] or [[Antidote++|antidote++ potions]] * Energy-restoring items such as [[energy potion]]s and [[stamina potion]]s * [[Prayer potion]]s * A [[knife]] for free healing, as there are pineapple plants around Ape Atoll * High healing [[food]] * A [[Lockpick]] * [[Weight-reducing clothing]] * Emergency teleport (a [[ring of life]] works as well) * [[Ardougne cloak 1]] or [[Ardougne teleport]]s [[File:Ardougne teleport (tablet).png]] * A [[ring of dueling]] to bank quickly (the Ardougne cloak could be used instead, somewhat further from a bank; the Battlefield of Khazard has a spirit tree, the gnome stronghold has a bank and the glider service) * 200,000 [[coins]] (if skipping the puzzle) |kills = * [[Jungle Demon]] ''(level 195)'' |ironman = * {{SCP|Smithing|40|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (to make the gold bar if not dropped by a monster) or {{SCP|Magic|33|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}} to tele-grab a gold bar from Varrock West bank. A gold bar is also a reward from [[The Digsite]], [[Goblin Diplomacy]], and [[Waterfall Quest]] }} ==Walkthrough== [[File:Monkey Madness I - Ape Atoll map.png|thumb|400px|All the routes you'll need to take in the quest.]] '''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' [[Ape Atoll]] is one of the most dangerous areas in the game, until you obtain a [[monkey greegree]]. When going to Ape Atoll, bring plenty of [[food]], [[Antipoison|antipoison potions]], and an emergency [[teleport]], in addition to other required items. Switching off [[Auto Retaliate]] and utilising [[protection prayers]] will greatly improve your chances of survival. This quest is divided into 4 chapters. ===Chapter 1=== '''''Items required:''' 3 free inventory spaces, Gnome Royal Seal (to enter the Karamja Shipyard & convince Lumdo). '''It is also recommended to bring the items from the next section so that you can save time of having to go back to the bank: lock pick, high-healing food, a form of poison protection, a knife.''''' :''"In which our hero/heroine finds himself/herself drawn back into Glough's web of deception and deceit."'' Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]]. He will tell you to investigate [[Glough]]'s old shipyard for any trace of the missing 10th squad and will give you the [[Gnome royal seal]]. Go to [[Karamja]]. You should take the [[glider]] at the top of the [[Grand Tree]] to Karamja (Gandius). '''If you do not have [[monkey bones]] (or a [[monkey corpse]]), kill a monkey to obtain some.''' Enter the [[shipyard]] north of the glider landing site and speak with [[G.L.O. Caranock]], a gnome who is located in the building in the southern area of the shipyard, by the fence. He will act very suspiciously and advise you to return to the king. Return to the king. The Gandius glider is out of service for now, so you'll need to take an alternative route. The quickest way back is to teleport to the [[Duel Arena]] using a [[ring of dueling]] then run west. Alternatively, you may teleport to the [[Ardougne Monastery]] with the [[Ardougne cloak]], then run northwest to the [[spirit tree]]. He will give you [[Narnode's orders]] and tell you to speak to [[Daero]]. '''There is a bank within the Grand Tree on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}. Use this time to bring some [[food]], [[antipoison potion]]s, and any other items to survive Ape Atoll (see recommended items above).''' Talk to [[Daero]], the new head tree guardian, on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the Grand Tree, near [[Blurberry Bar]] to the east. Go through all the chat options and then tell him you're prepared to leave. He will blindfold you and take you to an underground hangar. Talk to Daero again who will introduce you to [[Waydar]]. Then, you will have to solve a "reinitialisation" puzzle. Do this by clicking on the panel to the south-east by the southern glider. Players can take some [[spare controls]] from the nearby crate to view the solution. [[File:Monkey Madness I - Spare controls.png|thumb|220px|The solution to the reinitialization puzzle.]] Solve the sliding puzzle. #Begin by maneuvering the 1, 2 and 3 into their proper positions in the upper left corner. #Position the 4 in the upper right corner. #Maneuver the 5 under the 4 #Now slide the 4 to the left and the 5 up; the first row is done. #Repeat this process with next row, leaving row above intact. #The pieces in the last two rows then need to be solved together, working left to right, completing the last rows as 2 tiles high columns. This is similar to the [[puzzle box]]es from [[Treasure Trails]], so if you have done those before, this sliding puzzle will be easy to complete. If you cannot solve the puzzle or do not want to spend your time with it, bring 200,000 [[coins]] and go to Glough. Glough still resides where he did during the [[Grand Tree]] quest. If you pay Glough, return back to the hangar via Daero; Glough will leave you one tile to slide to complete it. Talk to Daero, then Waydar. The two of you will make landing on [[Crash Island]], where the 10th Squad crash landed. Ask [[Lumdo]] to sail to [[Ape Atoll]]. As he has conflicting orders from his sergeant, [[Garkor]], he will refuse to take you. Talk to Waydar (watch out for [[poisonous scorpion]]s just to his left, and '''do not''' click "Travel", as this will bring you back to the Grand tree prematurely). Speak with Lumdo again, and he will now agree to take you to Ape Atoll. [[File:Monkey Madness I - Caranock and the Foreman.png|thumb|right|Caranock speaks with the [[foreman]].]] ===Chapter 2=== :''"In which our hero/heroine finds themselves engaging in severe quantities of monkey business."'' :'''Note:''' There is no necessary combat until Chapter 4: "The Final Battle." ====Part 1==== '''''Items required:''' Recommended: High-healing [[food]], a form of [[poison]] protection, and a knife for free healing off of [[pineapple]] plants.'' :'''Note:''' At any point, you can teleport or flee from [[Ape Atoll]] to restock items. (To get back to the bank, you can talk to Lumdo to go from Ape Atoll back to Crash Island. Then talk to Waydar on Crash Island to go back to Tree Gnome Stronghold. Then you can use the bank in the Grand Tree. Then to resume the quest, talk to Daero on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the Grand Tree to go back to the hangar, then talk Waydar in the hangar to go back to Crash Island, then talk to Lumdo on Crash Island to return to Ape Atoll.) All native creatures other than the level 5 [[Bird]]s of Ape Atoll will be [[aggressive]] regardless of your [[combat level]] as long as you are in human form. You can hug the southern coast of Ape Atoll, heading west, to avoid the poisonous snakes and spiders. You may encounter only one or two snakes this way, and you can avoid them easily by waiting for them to pass. [[File:Monkey Madness I - Jail map.png|thumb|230px|left|The layout of the jail.]] [[File:Monkey Madness I - Hut map.png|thumb|230px|right|'''Blue:''' Door
'''Red:''' Dentures crate
'''Green:''' Banana crate
'''Yellow:''' Sleeping guard monkey]] {{Map|name=Garkor|x=2807|y=2762|r=3|mtype=square|caption=Garkor's location.|align=left|width=250|height=250}} [[File:Monkey Madness I - M'amulet mould location.png|thumb|230px|right|The location of the M'amulet moulds.]] Once on the Atoll, start going west, sticking to the southern coastline, until you reach a [[mahogany]] tree, at which point you should run north. Aggressive level 24 [[snake]]s, level 38 [[scorpion]]s, and level 42 [[jungle spider]]s, all of which are [[poisonous]], will attack if you are within their vicinity. Activate [[Protect from Missiles]] as you travel north, as a volley of poisoned arrows will start pelting you as you reach close to the Ape Atoll gate. You will be knocked out and placed into prison. You awake in a cell guarded by [[Trefaji]] and [[Aberab]], the two prison guards. Speak to [[Lumo]], one of the captured 10th Squad members. '''Stay one square away from the northern cell wall (near the patrolling guards' path) if the guards are in front of it, or else they will punch you for 10-20 damage.''' The guard will patrol twice throughout the prison, then leave to rotate shifts. As the guard moves away from your cell door, pick lock the door until you succeed. Once out, as the guard is walking out to switch, '''walk behind him to reach the exit.''' Note that this may take several tries. Travel north of the jail, then east to find [[Karam]], a member of the 10th Squad in the bushes near the crafting shop (chisel icon). Karam is mostly translucent and he can be difficult to spot, so look carefully. Travel south, past the large door, keeping in the jungle grass. When you are in the grass, the [[monkey archer]]s do not fire, but activate [[Protect from Missiles]] as a precaution. Once you are past the door, go around the castle counter-clockwise, east, until you are between the white building just south of the castle and the castle. To the east of that building is [[Garkor]], the Sergeant of the 10th Squad. Speak with Garkor. Make sure to get all the way through the dialogue to the point where he tells you to go meet [[Zooknock]]. Sprint west through the grass with Protect from Missiles on. Continue west (south of the buildings) in the grass until you reach the doorway to your north, the blue square on the map image with the red, blue, yellow and green square. Walk through the door marked by the blue square that will let you enter an enclosed area with a sleeping monkey guard, a banana crate, and '''a dentures crate'''. Enter the door. When inside this house, '''stay on the dark brown ground''' or you may be sent back to jail. The spiders inside are aggressive and poisonous, but their poison only hits '1' so it would be wise to save the antipoisons. There are bananas in the southwestern crates next to the ladder. '''Staying on the dark brown, step east and north, and search the stacked crates towards the middle of the room to acquire [[monkey dentures]].''' The sleeping guard is a non-threat so long as you don't talk to him, otherwise he will call for guards. Search the south-eastern most crate and where a prompt appears. You will take damage if you drop down into the cavern below, so heal up if necessary before entering. Your [[Agility]] level also has a chance to negate this damage. Travel to the north-west part of this cavern, and search the crates to acquire the [[M'amulet mould]]. If you need to resupply, you can exit the city by going to the south-east corner of the city. Run past the guards and the gravedigger to a ladder. Go up, jump off the bridge, and go back to the boat to [[Crash Island]]. You could also teleport out. {{clear}} ====Part 2==== '''''Items required:''' [[Monkey dentures]], [[m'amulet mould]], [[gold bar]]. Recommended: 1-2 [[antipoison potion]]s, 4+ [[energy potion]]s (or other energy-restoring items such as the [[Explorer's ring 1|Explorer's ring]]), 4+ [[prayer potion]]s (none will be necessary if [[flicking]] the Zombie monkeys), some [[food]], a [[plank]] (not actually necessary, but can be obtained during the quest anyway), and an emergency teleport ([[Ardougne cloak 1|Ardougne cloak]] is recommended, or use a [[dueling ring]] to go to the [[Duel Arena]], near a bank and glider).'' :'''Note:''' It's recommended to teleport out and bank at this point. The Zombie monkeys pose a significant nuisance as they will hit you while you are running past, they hit somewhat accurately and can deal moderate damage (max of 7). The whole dungeon is a multicombat area. The real threats are the gorilla skeletons; they are densely packed and hit accurately and quite hard (up to 12). :[[File:ironman chat badge.png]] [[Ironmen]]: If you don't have access to [[energy potion]] or [[prayer potions]] but have completed [[Recruitment Drive]], you can wear [[Initiate armour]] to reduce the Prayer drain while travelling through the cave. : : [[File:Ape Atoll Dungeon map.png|thumb|left|380px|[[Ape Atoll Dungeon]]]] Bank if necessary. Return to the [[Grand Tree]] and return to Daero on the 1st floor to get back to the glider hanger, and then to [[Ape Atoll]] afterward. Travel to the south of the island, west of [[Lumdo]], and enter the [[Ape Atoll Dungeon|tunnel]] ([[File:Dungeon icon.png]]). (A [[plank]] can be obtained in a run-down shack further west on the island) Once within the dungeon, you must travel through a long, winding underground path (see the image of the map). It is suggested to activate [[Protect from Melee]] as you make your way toward the north passage, flicking it off when not near any enemies to save prayer. The player will occasionally be hit by rocks, indicated by the screen shaking and a rumbling noise. The rocks can be avoided by sheltering under the numerous overhangs (grey areas on the map above), but can be largely ignored. The claw traps near the end of the dungeon can be easily avoided by stopping one square behind them and then running through; the plank is not actually needed, but can also be placed on the flat rock. Level 1 [[spider]]s are ubiquitous within this area, along with level 98 [[monkey zombie]]s and level 142 [[Skeleton (Ape Atoll)|skeletons]]. At the end, you will find [[Zooknock]], [[Waymottin]] and [[Bunkwicket]]; talk to Zooknock then use your [[m'amulet mould]], [[gold bar]], and [[monkey dentures]] on him. Make sure you are given an [[enchanted bar]] '''before''' leaving the tunnel. '''You MUST talk to Zooknock again! (If the enchanted bar is not given, use the ''monkey dentures, m'amulet mould, and gold bar'' on [[Zooknock]].)''' Do not use the m'amulet mould on Zooknock when you already have the enchanted bar otherwise he will keep it and you will have to obtain another. {{clear}} ====Part 3==== '''''Items required:''' [[Enchanted bar]], [[m'amulet mould]], [[ball of wool]], five free inventory slots for the bananas. Recommended: 1-2 [[antipoison potion]]s, [[lockpick]] (optional), a teleport ([[Ardougne cloak 1|Ardougne cloak]] or [[dueling ring]] recommended), and food. If you are going to do [[Recipe for Disaster]], kill a [[Monkey Guard]] for a [[Gorilla greegree]] later. (This requires ranged/magic at lower levels as Monkey Guards heal 25 hp when under 20% health in melee range.)'' Teleport, and bank if necessary. Return to [[Ape Atoll]] afterward, and continue north-west until you are placed in the jail cell again. Escape the cell as before. Travel east towards the temple door. [[File:Monkey Madness I - Ladder map.png|thumb|230px|left|The trapdoor is directly next to the ladder.]] Now, you must descend down through the trapdoor to the east in the temple (see inset map). Activate [[Protect from Melee]] to negate attacks from the powerful [[monkey guards]]. Most of the guards can be run through, but the ones with beards near the trapdoor cannot. The easiest route is to go upstairs, then climb the ladder down on the east side to get close to the trapdoor. If you do not, you should wait until the guards walk away. Hide in the north-east corner of the temple until there is enough room which you are able to descend. '''Be careful not to get surrounded or cornered by the monkey guards, or else you may be unable to escape (if you happen to get surrounded, go up the stairs and hop worlds). The ladder near the trap door can only be climbed up from the EAST side. You can also restore [[prayer points]] if needed at the monkey altar.''' Go down the trapdoor, still praying against melee. Ignore the [[monkey zombie]]s (or kill one and pick up the bones in case you want to do [[Recipe for Disaster]] (see below)), and swiftly use the [[enchanted bar]] on the [[wall of flame]]s. Travel back up the ladder or find a [[safespot]] to get away from the foes. Teleport away from Ape Atoll if you need to replenish supplies. Use the [[ball of wool]] with the amulet. After you have created the [[m'speak amulet]], you can either teleport out to resupply or continue on to the next step. '''Be careful! You will most likely be trapped again when you ascend the ladder, so be sure to activate Protect from Melee if you haven't already done so.''' Head to the building west of the jail (make sure you either sneak around in the grass, or use [[Protect from Missiles]] to run directly there). To the west of that building, there should be a banana garden that has a [[Monkey Child]] in it. The Monkey Child is being patrolled by [[The Monkey's Aunt]]. She follows a predetermined path that loops around the wooden house by the garden. Do not enter the banana garden when the monkey's aunt is present or she will call for guards to arrest you (if this happens, you can escape by quickly climbing up the ladder in the building beside). Wait for the aunt to walk away, then speak to the monkey child. '''Tip''': Using the ladder in the monkey's aunt's house nearby can help you escape the guards if the monkey's aunt catches you, but do not speak to [[The Monkey's Uncle]] upstairs or else he will call the guards too. Tell the monkey child that you are his uncle. After he reveals that he is supposed to collect 20 [[bananas]], search and pick five (5) from the nearby trees. '''You do not actually need 20; five is enough as the monkey cannot count.''' Wait for a few moments in the corridor, then return to the monkey child when the aunt is away. Ask the child to borrow his [[Monkey talisman]]. The drop trick can be used to get more than one; you will need to drop it and then speak to the monkey child, telling him you have lost the talisman. Then wait or hop worlds as the monkey child will start to cry and will not immediately give you another one. Alternatively, talismans can be purchased from [[Tutab's Magical Market]] for 1000 [[coins]]. '''The shop method only works if you have previously made at least one [[greegree]], as Tutab will not open his shop unless you are in monkey form.''' Get one talisman for each [[greegree]] you want, four are needed for Recipe for Disaster (see the below section). Exit [[Ape Atoll]]. :'''Note:''' For the [[Recipe for Disaster]] quest, you should get a total of four (4) talismans. Talismans can be purchased for 1000gp each at [[Tutab's Magical Market]]. '''Again, this method ONLY works if you have previously made at least one greegree, as you cannot access Tutab's shop in human form.''' Read below for info regarding the monkey bones you should gather for the quest. :'''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' Using teleportation of any sorts that take you out of Ape Atoll while wielding a greegree will forcibly unequip it to your inventory by the destination, if your inventory is full the greegree will be lost and you will have to make a new one. '''Recipe for Disaster:''' You will also need the additional three (3) greegrees (4 total (1 for Monkey Madness and 3 for Recipe for Disaster)). Each of these requires one talisman for a total of 4 talismans plus their respective monkey bones: You will save yourself 1-2 trips if you get all of these before going to [[Zooknock]] at this point. For all of the bones, you must kill one of each of the following: [[Monkey (monster)]] for the current quest, [[Monkey Archer]], [[Monkey Zombie]] and [[Monkey Guard]] for recipe for disaster. '''A Monkey Guard can be killed ''much'' more easily by safespotting it, they will only heal in melee range.''' The easiest ones to kill are located upstairs. Go through the front entrance (have Protect from Melee on then turn it off once you get up the ladder) then head for the southern ladder. You will find yourself in a corridor where you can safespot the guard. Once you have all of the required bones and talismans, take all 4 bones and 4 talismans to Zooknock to create them. If he does not take the next bones you give him right after he gives you your greegree, talk to him, and ask him to make another greegree. If this doesn't work, then try the [[drop trick]] with your greegree(s). ====Part 4==== '''''Items required: '''Materials for making the [[greegree]]s you want. For Monkey Madness I, only one [[monkey talisman]] and [[Monkey bones]] or [[monkey corpse|corpse]] are needed (make sure those are [[Monkey (monster)|Karamjan monkey]]'s bones or corpse; otherwise, you will have to run back again.). Recommended: 1-2 [[antipoison potion]]s, [[energy potion]]s, [[prayer potion]] and [[food]], a [[plank]], [[Ardougne teleport]].'' Bank for the necessary items and make sure you have a teleport again. '''If you have previously given Zooknock the bones or corpse, you do not need to re-obtain one.''' You will be heading back to [[Zooknock]] through the tunnel again. Return to [[Ape Atoll]]. Travel through the tunnel for a second time, and '''use''' the [[monkey talisman]] and the [[monkey bones]] '''(the left-click option for all types of bones is bury)''' (or [[Monkey corpse|corpse]]) on [[Zooknock]]. After a brief delay and conversation, you will get a greegree corresponding to the bones you used on him. To make another greegree, you have to first talk to him again and ask him if he can make another. '''If you cancel the conversation accidentally, ask how to make the monkey talisman and it will resume.''' ===Chapter 3=== '''''Items required:''' [[Karamjan monkey greegree]], [[m'speak amulet]], 1 free inventory space. Recommended: Ardougne teleport.'' {{quote|''In which our hero/heroine finds himself/herself contending with life as a monkey.''}} '''Note:''' In this chapter, you will be required to speak with Awowogei and retrieve a monkey from the Ardougne Zoo. You can skip to retrieving the monkey in Ardougne (Step 4) if you want to bank or resupply. You can speak with Awowogei when you return to Ape Atoll (Steps 1-3). '''Step 1''': Wield the [[monkey greegree]] (Karamjan only; the others '''WILL NOT''' work) to become a monkey! In this form, you will not be approached or attacked by any of the monkeys or wildlife on the island. Return to [[Garkor]], and speak to him in monkey form. Then, '''with the m'speak amulet equipped''', talk to the [[Elder Guard]] near Garkor, and he will tell you to speak with [[Kruk]].'''{{clear}} '''Step 2''': Run west, until you pass the main gate into [[Marim]] and have reached the Western shore of Ape Atoll (do not exit the gate). Head slightly south and follow a path up the western hill, then climb up the bamboo ladder at the top and cross the bamboo bridge. Take the ladder on the east side down and speak to Kruk and he will conveniently take you back to [[King Awowogei]].{{clear}} '''Step 3''': Speak to Awowogei and offer an alliance. He will ask you to rescue a monkey from the [[Ardougne Zoo]]. '''IMPORTANT: If you have a full inventory, DO NOT TELEPORT while wielding the greegree, as it will be dropped and potentially lost if you do.''' [[File:Monkey Madness I - G.L.O. and Awowogei.png|thumb|260px|left|Caranock, Waydar and King Awowogei plotting.]] '''Step 4''': Travel to [[Ardougne]] and enter the zoo. Wield the [[greegree]] to become a monkey. Speak to the [[Monkey minder]] (as a monkey), who will place you in the cage. Speak with a [[Monkey (Monkey Madness I)|monkey]] (the only one with a "Talk" option), and it'll hop into your inventory. Unequip the greegree and speak to the Monkey minder again. He will be confused and let you out. You will now need to travel by foot to the [[Gnome Stronghold]], and climb up to the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} and talk to [[Daero]] to travel back to Ape Atoll as usual. '''IMPORTANT: Any method of teleportation (including [[random events]]) will result in [[Monkey (Monkey Madness I)|the monkey]] leaving your inventory.''' :''Extra: Your new monkey friend will supply you with some humorous dialogue, and examining him will get you poked. If you have any [[bananas]] in your inventory, he will most likely eat them. There is also a 1/256 chance that he will give you a [[clue scroll (medium)]] if you use bananas on him directly. Note that you must go through the entire dialogue. Only one clue may be obtained per player{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/707250010379952128|date=9 March 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/JNE8Q|archivedate=30 May 2020|quote=1/256, and it's once only per player.}}.'' Return to Ape Atoll, and '''equip your greegree'''. Speak with Awowogei again. ''(If you have spoken before, you can simply speak to the Elder Guard, and he will let you in. If you have not, see Steps 1 through 3, above.)'' The monkey will automatically leave your backpack and Awowogei will consider an alliance. Speak with Garkor to begin Chapter 4. ===Chapter 4=== '''''Items required:''' [[Greegree]]. Recommended: 1-2 [[antipoison potion]]s, [[food]] and [[combat equipment]] to defeat a level 195 [[Jungle Demon]].'' {{quote|''"The Final Battle"''}} :'''Note:''' You can teleport to the [[Jungle Demon]] fight from anywhere in [[Gielinor]], except for the Wilderness, by simply equipping the [[10th squad sigil]]. [[File:Monkey Madness I - Jungle Demon fight.png|thumb|left|350px|The 10th squad and the player fight the demon.]] Speak with Garkor one more time (as a human or monkey). He will give you a [[10th squad sigil]]. ''Do not equip it'' until you are ready for the final battle! If you lose your last sigil, you must speak with Garkor again, who will send you to [[Waymottin]] at the end of [[Zooknock]]'s tunnel. Don't lose it. Bank in preparation for the [[Jungle Demon]] fight. Ensure you have full [[prayer points]] and health. When you are ready to fight, wear the sigil. You will be teleported to the Jungle Demon's arena shortly thereafter. Defeat the Jungle Demon to advance. The 10th Squad gnomes will be nearby to help you, but '''you must deal the final blow yourself, or the demon will heal for 25% of his max health'''. '''Note:''' This is NOT a safe battle. If you die during the battle, you will respawn with your 3 most valuable items. Go to [[Death's Office]] to retrieve your sigil and greegees, as well as many other items for free. If you teleport back into battle immediately, you can recover any other lost items. '''Potential strategies''' for fighting the Jungle Demon include the use of a [[Dwarf multicannon]], by [[ranging]]/[[maging]], or by luring the demon into the midst of 10th Squad gnomes. Bring [[prayer potion]]s, good food ([[lobsters]] or better), and a [[one-click teleport]] just in case. [[Protect from Magic]] is crucial, and should ideally be turned on just before you teleport. Bring an [[antipoison]] as well for the post-battle sequence. {{clear}} Other strategies include: *''Strategy for Ranged/Magic:'' Attacking with [[Magic]] or [[Ranged]] as well as having 37+ [[Prayer]] is recommended. There is a [[safespot]] in the arena across a bridge on the outside edge. From there, you can either range him, or lure him into the 10th Squad gnomes, who can weaken him. Once the Jungle Demon is within lethal range, with Protect from Magic still activated, run up to the Jungle Demon and Melee it once and run back. This will prevent the Jungle Demon from using his Melee attack while he continues to hit you with Magic which you protect from. '''Standing still''' once you are teleported to the arena will keep distance between you and the Jungle Demon. The demon will not move, and thus will not be able to approach you and use its [[Melee]] attack, which will result in you taking no damage throughout the fight as long as you keep your prayer up. *''Strategy for Melee:'' Using [[rings of recoil]] will help, especially when he hits hard. When the Jungle Demon reaches 1 HP from the gnomes, there will be a period of a few seconds before it regenerates its health. You can use Melee with this method. Another possible safespot is to block him on the middle area of the arena then walk over to him while he is still stuck (make sure to stay touching the wall while walking over or he will leave the wall and run at you) pray magic and you can get into halberd range without being hit by melee attacks. ==Finishing up== Once the Jungle Demon is slain, speak to Garkor, who is indicated by an arrow. He will tell you to speak to Zooknock to be teleported out. Speak to Zooknock to be teleported to Ape Atoll. If players decline the offer and stay, they are free to explore the [[Banana plantation (Ape Atoll)|banana plantation]]. However, Zooknock leaves, meaning that the other gnomes are the player's teleport out. In the base of the statue is a crack, which players can enter and speak to [[Bonzara]]. He offers to teleport the player out of the arena at the end of the conversation. *'''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' Both teleporters will put you in the jungle on Ape Atoll near [[poisonous]] and [[aggressive]] monsters, so be sure to have [[anti-poison]]! It is advised to simply teleport off of the island as quickly as possible (unless you're a level-1 Defence pure; see below). If you want to stay on the island, you should equip your Greegree immediately after being teleported by the gnomes. Escape the island however you like, either through the main gates as a monkey, with any form of teleport, or by jumping off the bridge in the south-east part of the city. Go back to [[Gnome Stronghold]]. *'''Advice for [[1-Defence pure]]s:''' Before returning to King Narnode, it is recommended that you: 1. Chop and burn a teak log (note, log must be cut from a teak tree on Ape Atoll) and fish for [[raw bass]] for the [[medium Western Provinces Diary]]. 2. Chop and burn a mahogany log and do a lap of the agility course for the [[hard Western Provinces Diary]]. 3. Have a [[Monkey minder|zookeeper]] put you in [[Ardougne Zoo]]'s monkey cage for the [[hard Ardougne Diary]]. *'''Note for [[1-Defence pure]]s:''' Talking to [[King Narnode]] and completing the quest will result in you no longer being able to return to [[Ape Atoll]] without claiming the experience, which will raise your [[Defence]] to at least 33. Do not finish the quest before training on [[skeleton]]s with [[chinchompas]] if you intend to make use of the training location in the future. As a pure, you can kill the [[Jungle Demon]] and still return to Ape Atoll after its death, but if you talk to King Narnode, you will be unable to return without getting the Defence experience. Speak with [[King Narnode]] in the [[Grand Tree]] to finish the quest. '''Congratulations! Quest complete! ''' Narnode will then redirect you to [[Daero]] for your training as a new 10th squad member, so go have a chat with Daero for the experience rewards. ==Rewards== {{Quest rewards |name = Monkey Madness I |image = [[File:Monkey Madness I reward scroll.png|centre]] |qp = 3 |rewards = *10,000 [[Coins]] *3 [[Diamond]]s *Speaking to [[Daero]] after the quest gives the choice of either, 35,000 [[experience]] in {{SCP|Attack}} [[Attack]] and {{SCP|Defence}} [[Defence]] and 20,000 [[experience]] in {{SCP|Strength}} [[Strength]] and {{SCP|Hitpoints}} [[Hitpoints]] '''OR''' 35,000 [[experience]] in {{SCP|Strength}} [[Strength]] and {{SCP|Hitpoints}} [[Hitpoints]] and 20,000 [[experience]] in {{SCP|Attack}} [[Attack]] and {{SCP|Defence}} [[Defence]]. Returning to [[Ape Atoll]] after completing the quest requires undergoing Daero's training. **'''Note for 1-Defence pures:''' You cannot go back to the bunker (and thus back to [[Ape Atoll]]) without speaking to Daero and gaining Defence XP. The only way to return to Ape Atoll as a pure is to stop the quest after killing the Jungle Demon. Do not talk to King Narnode Shareen. *The ability to buy and wield the [[Dragon scimitar]]. *The ability to turn into a monkey in Ape Atoll & [[Ardougne Zoo]], using the [[Monkey greegree]]. *Full access to Ape Atoll. (Bank is unlocked after [[Monkey Madness II]].) }} ==Required for completing== Completion of Monkey Madness I is required for the following: *[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowogei]] *[[Monkey Madness II]] ==Music unlocked== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name ! class="unsortable" | Unlock details ! class="unsortable" | Music track |- |[[Anywhere]] |Unlocked at [[Marim]]'s main gate on [[Ape Atoll]]. |[[File:Anywhere.ogg]] |- |[[Find My Way]] |Unlocked in the [[Ape Atoll Dungeon]] |[[File:Find My Way.ogg]] |- |[[Island Life]] |Unlocked on [[Ape Atoll]] |[[File:Island Life.ogg]] |- |[[Marooned]] |Unlocked on [[Crash Island]] |[[File:Marooned.ogg]] |- |[[Monkey Madness]] |Unlocked in [[Marim]] |[[File:Monkey Madness.ogg]] |- |[[Showdown]] |Unlocked in the boss fight at the end of the quest |[[File:Showdown.ogg]] |- |[[Suspicious]] |Unlocked during cutscenes |[[File:Suspicious.ogg]] |- |[[Technology]] |Unlocked in the [[gnome glider]] hangar |[[File:Technology.ogg]] |- |[[Temple]] |Unlocked in [[Temple of Marimbo]] dungeon |[[File:Temple.ogg]] |} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = |update = |daterange = 10 May 2016 — 28 July 2016 |change = The quest was renamed from ''Monkey Madness'' to ''Monkey Madness I''. }} {{Subject changes |date = 26 November 2015 |update = Zulrah Scale Fishing |change = Typo correction: to was used rather than too in Monkey Madness. }} {{Subject changes |date = 2 July 2015 |update = Clue Scroll Step Counter |poll = Old School Content Poll 34: XP droplets & Slayer |change = Added a [[Fairy Rings|fairy ring]] midway through the [[Ape Atoll Agility Course|Ape Atoll agility course]]. Using this fairy ring requires completion of [[Monkey Madness I|Monkey Madness]] and [[Daero|Daero's training]]. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Trivia== *If you talk to [[Zeke]], the scimitar seller of [[Al Kharid]], and ask him for a [[Dragon scimitar]], he will respond, "The banana-brained nitwits who make them would never sell any to me. Seriously, you'll be a monkey's uncle before you hold a Dragon Scimitar." This dialogue is a reference to this quest, during which you pretend to be a monkey's uncle in order to obtain a [[monkey talisman]]. *If you have started [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen]], completing this quest and receiving Daero's training unlocks a new [[fairy ring]] location in the [[Ape Atoll Agility Course|Ape Atoll agility course]]. In order to leave the small area where the fairy ring is located, you will need a [[ninja greegree]] and 48 [[Agility]] to continue through the remainder of the agility course. *If you tell [[Zooknock]] you lost the amulet, you will have to get the materials to create a new one. *If you wear a [[M'speak amulet]] and listen to the [[enchanted bar]], it says "I'm stuck in this horrible gold bar!" *The chapter cards and cut scenes in this quest are references to the adventure game series ''Monkey Island''. *Upon first talking to [[Awowogei]], [[Uwogo]] says to "never trust a northern monkey". This is in reference to the friendly rivalry between the north and the south within the UK (Northern Monkeys, Southern Fairies). *You can pick up the Karamjan monkey King Awowogei requests after bringing him to the island. If a player picks up the monkey delivered to King Awowogei after bringing him to the king, travels to Karamja by foot and drops the monkey, the player will receive their level in Thieving experience multiplied by two. *[[Karam]] seems to be a reference to Kalam Mekhar (a character from Steven Erikson's Malazan book of the fallen) and the 10th squad in general could be a reference to the Bridgeburners 9th squad from the same series. *This entire quest was created by one intern at Jagex during a summer internship. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Monkey Madness I}}
